medical_history.chief_complaint: PTH-dependent hypercalcemia with mild polydipsia and polyuria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was well until age 14 when diagnosed with Hashimoto’s thyroiditis. At age 18, elevated serum calcium was noted (3.05 mmol/liter). Subsequent calcium levels fluctuated between 2.68 – 2.95 mmol/liter. The patient has remained stable but hypercalcemic, with mild symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hashimoto's thyroiditis at age 14, hepatitis A at age 4 years, and a 2-year history of irregular menses associated with vigorous exercise and weight loss.
medical_history.family_history: Family history positive for Hashimoto’s thyroiditis; younger sister diagnosed with hypothyroidism and hypercalcemia.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a college sophomore living in Bolivia when not attending college.
